website_summaries.verdict: A mid-priced tent that has a combination of some nice features and some longevity concerns. Worth considering for occasional backpackers.
pros: Although this tent weighs in around 4 pounds, the roomy interior can comfortably fit 2 people with space left over for gear
Easy to set up and take down
Owners rave about attentive customer service
Despite the low price, this tent is backed by a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Crossbar has sharp ends that could eventually result in torn material
Mesh components are flimsy and prone to ripping
Zippers and seams could be more durable

customer_reviews.title: Dry as a bone inside in the remanent of a hurricane
customer_reviews.text: This tent looks like some other tents. I tried 2 before I found this one. Comes with a foot print that is perfect The rain fly is very waterproof. The floor is as well. As you can see in the attached video I have tested it through 5 thunderstorms now and 2 wind storms. The only thing I don’t like is the roof poles are not covered from the rain fly. Someone else mentioned that and I think they are right. Great price. Keeps out the rain. Has great night visibility in the night if you take the rain fly off. Plenty of room and light enough to carry in your backpack and live luxuriously.
customer_reviews.author: JXD

customer_reviews.title: Great value, OK weight
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to test this tent to its extremes yet, but it's definitely solid. The inclusion of a footprint is great if needed. The vestibules have enough space to store your packs if needed. The interior is spacious and has a mounting point for a lantern/light at the top. The weight isn't ideal, but it compares to tents in this range, so it's not necessarily something to skip over this tent for. Setup is a breeze. It'll be a few minutes to assemble if you have another person attacking it with you.
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Claude Waight

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and well designed
customer_reviews.text: I was able to put this up on the first trip out in under 15 minutes. Like all "2 person" tents, it is more likely a 1 person, at least for a >6 foot person. I could probably share with another smaller person, but would be zero gear room. Love how the doors work and that there is one on each side. Simple and well thought-out. Great tent. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: blkZ

customer_reviews.title: Appalachian Trail
customer_reviews.text: Great little tent. Bought this for an upcoming hike on the AT - have used it a handful of times up to now to practice and work on setup/take down. The assembly is very easy, the tent is very cozy with two people but should work out well. The vestibules aren't as roomy as some of the reviews had me believe before I bought it (we'll likely leave our 50L packs protected under a tarp separately from the tent), but they have enough space to at least protect your boots or small bags.
customer_reviews.author: compaq user

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Featherstone 2 person backpacking tent based on the many positive reviews of other folks. It is perfect for my needs; compact, light weight, but roomy inside. The Featherstone folks were extremely helpful. The tent arrived within 2 days of purchase. I couldn't be happier (although my friend is sad, as he paid about 3x as much for the same quality tent from another well known company)!! Thanks Featherstone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mills

customer_reviews.title: More than what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. You get a lot of bang for your buck, and this tent is made of excellent quality. My last tent finally gave in and came apart after one too many trips. I bought this one in replacement, and you can't really go wrong with it. The tent comfortably fits two. You could even try to squeeze three in if needed, but it'd be a bit tight. Set up is convenient as well. Definitely would recommend for the value, quality, and price.
customer_reviews.author: DanielY

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for dirt bike/dual sport camping. i was able to roll ground cloth,tent and fly in one bag and the poles in their own bag. I used a small twin air mattress with foot pump, seemed like my feet were touching one side of the tent depending on position @ 6'3 380. Very nice and fast setup fits inside my 40L bag.
customer_reviews.author: Darthanian

customer_reviews.title: Decent backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: I brought just the tent and the poles with me on a backpacking trip, because that was the lightest combo. The tent bottom is very thin, but on dry ground it was fine. The mesh rips easily, but then again there were 5 dogs on the trip and I only got a couple small holes, so all-in-all it was fine. The tent + poles combo is good for summer backpacking trips. I got the tent for me and my two dogs, and it was the perfect amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Nickel

customer_reviews.title: Practical, light weight, roomy, 3 season tent.
customer_reviews.text: A great tent that is light, roomy and easy to set up. Had no real complaints in the time I have been on my thru hike on the AP. It was unseasonably cold and rainy this April and it kept me dry. Need to get a few extra peg / stakes and if possible a little heavier than what comes with the tent. Winds were over 30mph during one storm that lasted fifteen hours and water infiltration was only starting to come in at the very end. When I pulled up the ground cloth it was completely dry underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Fyrecurl

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent a couple of times for backpacking trips. It is lightweight, easy to assemble, and mostly high quality. One small negative is that two of the stakes bent during the second use and I was not pounding on them hard. We also set this tent up at a camp site with grass and three of the kids stepped on the stakes with bare feet and got scratched/cut. That issue is not so much a negative as something to be aware of. The material for the flooring and rainfly is high quality. The zippers and other components seem to be good quality. I have confidence in this tent and it is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for comfort and setup time!
customer_reviews.text: "what the... Wait you're already done?" Those were the words my friends said to us as we finished setting up the tent in a minute? Maybe 2 minutes? The setup on this tent is so fast its frightening. It's also insanely lightweight. I have zero complaints about this tent and I have no qualms with the price. I also am so thankful that the rain fly stays off the tent itself so there is no condensation that gets within the tent! I would most definitely buy again and recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Quin

customer_reviews.title: Just a perfect little tent.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tent. It is very lightweight and compact when in the bag. The doors on each side are convenient especially with two people in the tent. The thing I love the most is the size of the see through mess. You can see all the stars at night as well as on the sides as well. Two people is a pretty tight but that should be expected. Overall I am really impressed with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: spuda

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent for the money! I think I paid roughly $65 and I've already used it three times. No tears, no stuck zippers, easy storage, setup and take down. One of the easier tents I've ever had to assemble. You won't be disappointed considering the uber-affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Whit Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Water OUT
customer_reviews.text: I used this almost daily on a two month cross-country trip and it held up fantastically. But for me what really makes this amazing is when I was in Allegheny my campsite flooded up to about knee-deep during a rainstorm and I only realized it when I put my hand on the floor of a tent to find it was like a waterbed - inside of the tent though? Pretty damn dry! I had to abandon the camp and come back the next day, and the floor of the tent was damp, but I could have crawled back in and used it right away if necessary. Amazing job, would absolutely recommend and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent! Tall teens loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Good wind & rainproofing! Could fit 3 teenagers inside, if needed. My thirteen-year-old son (5' 9 1/2") and his friend (6' 1") slept comfortably in it for 4 nights on their backpackaging trip this summer. The weather was good, so the rainproofing wasn't tested, but from the construction it looks as if it would holdup well. The wind didn't bother them. They did divide the poles from the rest of the tent to share the weight load, since it isn't as light as some other backpacking tents.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey S.

customer_reviews.title: I have failed. .
customer_reviews.text: . . to find a flaw with this tent. As my ratings indicate, this tent has earned 5 stars across the board! It's a shadow in my backpack weight wise, easy to set up/break down. If your not able to set it up, pull a blanket over your head, it's nearly that easy. I move around a lot while sleeping & with all my tossing & turning, I didn't hurt it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: A bargain version of the MSR Hubba Hubba
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially the identical configuration (pole structure, fly, doors, dimensions) to the MSR Hubba Hubba, just WAY less expensive. The materials and workmanship are top notch. I really feel like the only thing I've sacrificed in buying this model is the brand name. Very light for the space it provides, sets up easily, and is just as strong and durable as brand-name tents of similar weight. Do yourself a favor and don't blow hundreds of extra dollars just for the name stenciled on your tent. This one's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: CO Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great tent at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought more at the lower price point! I bought several of these for my Venturing Crew to use on our backpacking trips. My 8 year olds are able to set it up. The tents are super easy to setup, and have plenty of room. The tents have performed well in the rain, and also with wind. The aluminum poles are sturdy. The purchase is an all in one deal. That means you don't have to go purchase the footprint separately. Even at it's current price, I believe it is one of the best deals you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Tight, but comfortable.  Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only tested this briefly, but it seems nice and sturdy. I’ll probably update as I use it, but I like it so far. It’s a bit cramped for two people. My best friend and I are average (not athletic average, just regular average) size women and we were pretty tight so you’d want to make sure you and your tentmate are OK with the space, especially if you both move a lot in your sleep. It’s really easy to set up, though, and the price is nice so I’d recommend it if you want a nice, compact tent.
customer_reviews.author: Eirea

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Returned before finished unboxing. Design is ok, which is a shame, because the materials are atrocious. This tent will NOT hold up and WILL leak. Again, the materials are cheap and substandard. At half the price, this tent would barely make the cut of 'acceptable'. But at $100 its not even in consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Snickers10

customer_reviews.title: Best ultralight for the price 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: Great backpacking tent! Worked like a champ on my 10 day backcountry elk hunt. It was lows in the 20’s, windy and rainy for parts of the trip and the tent held up great. No leaks and kelp me out of the weather. Plenty of room in vestibule for my bow, pack and boots at night and room inside for all my other gear. Only negative is that it’s a hair heavy (6lbs) compared to more expensive ultralight tents but can’t beat it for the under $100 I paid. Also great for my son and I in the backyard camping.
customer_reviews.author: MWaldron

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tent has worked perfectly for us as a day use tent and to store a family of four’s clothes on longer trips. We haven’t used it in challenging conditions yet, but I get the sense it would do OK. It’s got reflective tape on the zippers, which catches the flash light and is super easy to set up. It’s also a good summer tent as the tent itself is mostly screen and the rain fly goes over when you need privacy, additional insulation or shelter from rain. Not sure about the strength of the poles, but I’ll post an update if/when we find out. Nice tent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Burns

customer_reviews.title: Best one after researching many others
customer_reviews.text: I havent set it up yet because there is snow outside but after reading reviews on sooo many lightweight tents i decided on this one. I really wanted the nemo hornet but too rich for my blood. This one has two doors which is awesome so i am not trampling over my husband in the middle of the night for a pee run. There are 2 vestibules for keeping gear dry. Its lightweight and looks easy to set up. Im taking a chance and hoping it pays off! I got this for ultralight backpacking on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Paradise*Gardens

customer_reviews.title: Not for cold and windy weather. Great summer tent.
customer_reviews.text: This lets a lot of air thru the bottom of the rain fly. It would be close to perfect if the fly was able to be staked all the way to the ground. It made changing and sleeping on a windy, 26 deg F night uncomfortable. On a calm wind night, it was great. I will only use this tent as a summer tent from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Winner winner chicken dinner.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, rewriting this review. First off you cannot beat this price for this quality of this tent. Been in tents 3x the price that I'm not as happy with. I'm 6'1 and have had issues even with 2 person tents. I've now done several trips with this tent from 30 degrees to low 90's.Rain, wind, heat etc. Ive put it through the ringer. I ran into a small snag and with a 5 min phone call at 8pm their customer service sent what I needed not 10 mins later. Great company, great customer service, great tent. I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah

customer_reviews.title: Great for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for my gear and I. Would be fine for 2 just to sleep but not much extra room. Love the dual entry and. Fly comes down low. It didn’t rain so could not check how rainproof it is. The clips to secure to the frame are clear lightweight plastic that look “cheap” . Took some plastic ties just in case they would snaps. Wish they were more durable material.
customer_reviews.author: Judith M. Galante

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great customer support. I was contacted by the manufacturer within 24 hours of receiving the product. I had a very small issue that they provided a solution within 24 hours. The tent can be set up in less the five minutes and has significant room easily for two people. Took the tent on first camping trip - no complaints. Light rain came through during the night for about 30 minutes with no leakage. I look forward to additional products from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Jones

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was going to go the ultra light route, but read really good reviews to the stability especially against the elements. Just went camping this past weekend and it worked well; easy to set up and take down. Camped in 95 degree weather. Provided really good ventilation. Update: still a good tent, but had to drop it down a star because bugs LOVE getting in between the tent and the cover because of the white color. Just be aware of this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bondoc

customer_reviews.title: 40mph wind gusts and heavy rain.
customer_reviews.text: Good tent. 28*F, Heavy rain and 20mph winds with 40mph gusts and could hardly feel Any wind inside of tent and no rain dripped in. Had to set it up with light rain so can’t tell if bottom of tent even with the footprint stops water front coming up from bottom. Over all was happy with it. One thing that sucks... had the wind blow up some hot coals from fire and now i have some holes in tent :( really sucks cause i liked it but now is useless 😞
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Super Light and easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: Needed a light weight tent for a multi-day hike into Supai in the Grand Canyon. This worked great. Many of my colleagues were packing tents I had looked at but decided against because they seemed way too expensive. I was able to set up and break down more quickly than others, had plenty of room, and slept even better knowing I had saved hundreds of dollars! Looking forward to many more adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and mighty
customer_reviews.text: Great tiny tent. I'm small and can only just sit up in it. But that's what I wanted. Low profile, easy to put together, and functional. Taking it down and getting it back in the bag is a whole different story, but overall it was great for the two nights I've been able to use it so far. Hopefully the quality remains great and I can use it for years. It did keep all the mosquitos out so that it's a huge bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Oloughlin

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one fine tent! Held up wonderfully dry during a night of fairly heavy rain. Used the footprint as well as the integrated base. Even the vestibules were essentially dry. Was very easy to setup, and although weight isn't as big an issue for a kayak camper, I do love the small package in four pieces which made it very easy to fit in small spaces between larger gear within my kayak. Well worth the hundred bucks. Only thing I wonder about is getting parts for it. Is there a way to purchase extra stakes, lines, poles and a more generous patch kit?
customer_reviews.author: N. Mcaleavey

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is so small to store and very lightweight, it's a perfect backpacking tent. Very roomy with two relatively small people and two medium sized dogs. We took it to Yellowstone during a very wet and rainy weekend and it worked perfect! The rain cover lasted through a thunderstorm with no leaks. The footprint didn't let any water inside from the ground. It stayed up during wind. They hook at the top worked perfect to hang out lantern inside! Takes only a few minutes to set up and take down. Definitely a steal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight about  6lbs with everything.
customer_reviews.text: Tent used 3 times for boys scout camping Light weight Really Easy to assemble Like that it comes with foot print Material is very thin but have not used enough to say if it Is durable or not. Stakes are good and tent holds with moderate wind Dislike that rain cover does not have a place for cross bar tip to sit/hook on. With wind the cross bar tip rubs on non reinforced part of rain cover. I think This could tear with time.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We've used these tents on multiple occasions and love them. Having two doors is a huge plus to these tents. The pockets on the inside are great for your small stuff and there is a hook in the center to hang a lantern. These have held up really nicely and we are pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Wigley

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this on 2 camping trips in the Sierra Nevada desert and to another dusty part of Sequoia National Park, and this tent has been spectacular. Easy to set up because the poles are a single frame, and it's easy to breakdown, and flip over to shake out all the dust before rolling it back up. Plenty of space for me, my stuff, and my blue heeler. Might be a bit heavy as a backpacking tent with all the equipment, but it's definitely a fantastic car camping unit.
customer_reviews.author: MaximMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tent, Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent to NM at the end of September. The mesh allowed the breeze to come through in the heat of the day. The rain fly blocked the cooler night breezes, but we were getting chilly towards morning (about 40 degrees). This tent takes only a couple of minutes to put together. It's super light and compact, with plenty of room for two to sleep. There's no extra room for gear, but that's kind of the trade-off when you buy a light and compact tent. I would recommend this tent to anybody doing spring, summer, or fall camping.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Millican

customer_reviews.title: Great so far. I recommend it for 3 season backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent for the price, though I haven't had it out in rainy weather yet. Slept my brother (6' 2") and myself (5' 10") comfortably when positioned opposite from one another. The 2 door configuration, both with vestibules is great. There really isn't any room for additional items in the tent if sleeping two, so having the ability to use the rain fly to protect my shoes and back pack was a big plus. I found refolding the tent and packing everything back into the bag to be pretty easy. Also really nice that it comes with a footprint.
customer_reviews.author: BB1978

customer_reviews.title: Love the tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent has two different setup options for backpacking. The ultralight setup is my favorite because it weights less than 5oz. The full setup maybe a couple oz heavier than my other name brand tents but this one feels more spacious inside. This is definitely one of the best purchases I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: First trip out was wet and muddy and the campsite was rough to say the least. We had strong wind gusting and rain most of the night. I was dry and never had to adjust the rain fly after staking it out. A great tent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase,  Quality Tent
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased last week and took on back country camp trip. Worked perfect. No BS. Im no back country guide, but for us average non extreme condition campers and hikers, this is a solid purchase. I felt I was taking a step down in quality, in relation to same size Eureka I had. the pole snapped for no particular reason and parts unavailable. But....in my opinion, this tent is a step up in quality, and a better price. IMHO
customer_reviews.author: Robbie T.

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy set up!
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was delayed, so thankfully I didn’t need it right away. Once received, I opened it up and set it up-didn’t need any instructions because it was that easy. The aluminum pole almost put itself together! It was roomy inside, but I did notice that I’m going to have to be careful as it’s not as sturdy as my previous tent, but it’s also pounds light! Overall I’m happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT Tent For the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent because I quickly found out (after purchasing one) that I was simply too big to sleep in a one-person tent comfortably with gear. This tent gives me the opportunity to stretch out and be comfortable and still has plenty of room for my gear. It's very well constructed and incredibly lightweight considering this is a standalone, two person tent that INCLUDES a footprint. There are plenty of lighter tents out there for triple the price but this one meets and all of my requirements and didn't break the bank so I can deal with a few extra ounces. If you're thinking about it, GO FOR IT!
customer_reviews.author: Rackham's Razor

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Seam Unraveled
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tent, it is durable material, keeps the water out, comes with stakes, guylines, and a footprint. The seam on one of the door zippers for the inner mesh started to unravel rendering the zipper completely useless. It happened on the second time I used the tent. Now I can only go in and out of 1 door. If you buy this tent make sure to inspect the stitching on the zippers and make sure that it's all sewn well and return it ahead of time if it's not.
customer_reviews.author: William C Giltner

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: The first time I set this tent up in Alaska the stitching on the bottom of one of the vestibules started to unravel and on the fourth day the hoop on the zipper that holds the pull tab broke. I suspect poor workmanship, quality control and cheap materials are to blame. This may or may not be an isolated incident. You make your own decision. I would have returned the tent if I had not just missed the deadline when I returned from Alaska
customer_reviews.author: Bruce H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from my first outing with this tent. I was at 10,000 ft in the Colorado Rockies on January18. It was a little breezy, but the tent stood tall. This tent is very easy to set up; 5 minutes at the most. The temperature hovered at 18 degrees most of the night, but I was warm (0 degree bag as well). The only negative are the flimsy stakes, but the ground was frozen. I will replace them with some hooked ones anyway. I recommend this tent; great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Took the Feather stone tent camping over the weekend, it rained all weekend with varying levels of rain. The inside of the tent stayed dry with the exception of a little moisture seeping in underneath my sleeping pad. Over all very comfortable tent I'm 6'1" and was able to sleep without touching the sides of the tent. It could fit 2 people without any equipment but it would be possible.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup
customer_reviews.text: Very quick setup and great for backpacking. We hiked past sunset most days on our backpacking trip so it was nice to have a light tent that was quick and easy to set up. And the price can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: slsch

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tent
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent twice since I bought it a month ago and couldn’t be more pleased. I wanted something that was a balance of weight, ease of use, features, and price. And when it rains, I want to stay dry. This tent satisfies all of my requirements and then some!
customer_reviews.author: KaiH

customer_reviews.title: Buy this tent!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing. I set it up last night and it was a breeze. Took maybe 5 minutes to do by myself. Everything seems very durable. I am an avid camper/hiker and for the price I dont think you can find a better tent. I will update this after a few overnight hikes. I plan on buying a spare just because this thing is so amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up and take down even for one person. It rained all day and night with strong wind at times and my stuff stayed dry. I don't know how it will hold up, only have used it for a 2 night stay. Seems very good
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: When I first took a look at the tent on my floor I also looked for directions. No directions. However, after a few trial and errors I figured it out. Whatever happened to written directions? Why should a customer have to guess and re-guess his way through assembly? Turns out = it's easy to assemble (but why have to guess one's way through the assembly?).
customer_reviews.author: ndarrohn

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, not spacious for two people but definitely fits two people. Packs up and easily fits back into the tent bag and I like that the ground tarp has its own bag, for when that's particularly dirty. The two vestibules and doors are great
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice backpacking tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty nice and super easy to assemble but it's not lightweight-ultrasmall backpacking tent. So far spent 3 nights in it. It took30 mph wind no problem and very little dust got inside.
customer_reviews.author: Yuriy Postrekhin

customer_reviews.title: Roomy for a 2 person tent
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure: I have only taken this tent on one three-night camping trip, but it was great. We did get a little bit of rain and everything stayed nice and dry. The tent is surprisingly large inside for a 2 person tent. It is considerably roomier than my previous 2 person tent because the walls go almost straight up, instead of angling in. No more feet or head rubbing on the walls! The double entries/vestibules are great. Both entrances can be opened for some cross-ventilation, and the vestibules are plenty large for storing shoes and backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Superb Tent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The first time I took this tent out camping there was a tremendous hail storm and torrential rain storm. The tent is superb not a drop of water inside and the tent had no issues with the hail. It was very easy to set up. The weight is excellent for $80.00. I know that I can pay $500.00 for a 1 to 1.5 Lb tent but I am not going to spend 6 months in it hiking the Appalachain Trail. For a couple of day hiking trip this tent is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I've been out three times with this tent. It is easy to put up and I like the two vestibules. This tent is roomy enough for my dog, my gear and I. Unfortunately, during my second camping trip two of the clips broke. I emailed Featherstone right away and William responded quickly. I responded with the needed information. William resolved the problem quickly. Customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Deb D

customer_reviews.title: Great design, quality, and value
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased w/ this tent. Super easy set up and it kept me dry in a pretty good storm. The mesh was torn at the fabric where the hook ties into the ceiling. They replaced it quickly. Some say it’s too heavy for backpacking. It is a 2 person tent. Used it for a fishing trip and it was perfect. Stayed warm. Great value!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good price but a little heavy for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very easy to assemble and pack up. Good placement for pockets and hooks and quality materials were used. Did not need directions to figure out how to set up in about 5 minutes. My only disappointment is how heavy it is. Yes I can leave some of the materials behind for drop in weight but would definitely sacrifice quality overall of product and comfort to do that. I will make this work for the price point. Overall a very good and easy to put together tent.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Snug and relatively decent
customer_reviews.text: We went camping in The Appalachians two weeks ago. Was a bit windy and damp that night but the tent held up nicely. It’s kind of flimsy yet easy to put together and surprisingly durable. Not camping every weekend durable but a decent buy for a light summer tent.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderbird

customer_reviews.title: It's easy for a newbie to set up and take down ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to backpacking and have been looking for a well-made, lightweight tent that didn't cost a fortune. I tried it this past weekend in my backyard and left it up for 3 days in windy conditions with rain/sleet/snow mix. Stayed dry as a bone. It's easy for a newbie to set up and take down and it is a great price!
customer_reviews.author: UnHappy customer

customer_reviews.title: great backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: My partner and I have used this for several backpacking trips of 2-5 days. We love this tent! It's very easy to construct, compact, and lightweight. It does well in cold weather as well, though I would not take it out below freezing. But between 30 and 40 degrees it is manageable. We've been rained on a few times and only had minor condensation. Enough space for two people and packs, though it helps that neither of us are especially big or tall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Set it up a couple times in the backyard to get the feel of assembly just in case I have to set it up in the dark and also to try different folding methods for pack up. It goes up fairly quick and easy. Looks small on the outside but is quite roomy on the inside. The attached pic is after my 3rd attempt at packing it up so it's basically folded completely different than when received but still fits. Will be going on an overnight backpack trip soon and will update with how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Stayed dry. A little small.
customer_reviews.text: I just used it for first time and it rained all night. I stayed perfectly dry inside. It's a little small. My sleeping pad is slightly longer than the tent and I can't sit up without my head touching the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: any

customer_reviews.title: Aweome tent but very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together was a breeze and it felt very sturdy. I LOVE the tent and its super breathable. The only issue with the tent is it's heavy with all the parts to it. Yes, you can remove the rainguard and such but I want the full package to be lightweight for backpacking. I wanted this tent to work but it's just way to heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Affordable AND reliable
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent twice so far. Very smart design. Kept dew (and general lake effect moisture) out, but haven't encountered rain yet. Honestly couldn't be happier with this product. Especially taking into account the crazy low price.
customer_reviews.author: Christin Basham

customer_reviews.title: New Backpacker
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect tent for my backpacking trip. It fit nicely on the bottom of my bag, was easy to set up, and I was able to get everything back in the bag after. I was camping in the Havasupai Reservation. At night we had wind gust up to 30 MPH with no issue. Did not experience rain but feel it would hold up nicely with the slash guard. Great storage area for gear on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Hannon

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I love it love it love it. I love that it’s all screen so you can sleep under the stars. I love that it has a big rain cover. I love that has access on both sides of the tent. My girlfriend and I slept in it very comfortably together. I’m 6’ 4” tall and she’s 5’10”. We both really like the set up. And the tent stakes are amazing very strong and durable. I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DorsalPort10

customer_reviews.title: Met my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used twice thus far. It easy to set up! Really liked that it came with a footprint. I'm 6'0 and 205 lbs. I wouldn't recommend a second person in the tent though. Unless your comfortable with snuggling up! Both times I have used this tent, the temperature reached a low of 49 F. Was very comfortable in the tent. When ready to leave it was just as easy to take down and pack up. If your looking for a good 2 person tent ( 1 person as far as I'm concerned ) this is it.
customer_reviews.author: James Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought and used this tent in Joshua Tree. I got there late so I had to set up camp in the dark and it was my first time using the tent. It went up flawless within about 3 minutes. Easy to fold back into the cover. I could see the stars perfectly from inside my tent and the vents definitely kept it cool within my tent. I would say this was the easiest tent I ever had to set up and take down. I left my tent open and at night you could not see into my tent at all. During the day, It obviously provided little privacy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I am going to try it in 2 rainy nights. so far I can tell the assembly was very easy. Will update my review after using it. *Update: I have used it last weekend in Lake Charles. The first night went well but it was raining for couple of hours in second day and the water gets in from the bottom. so, its not waterproof as it advertised. I need to use my tent in Texas and expect heavy rain every now and then when camping. This is a nice car camping tent and is light weight but not good enough for rainy weather. I have to replace it with something ofwith better quality.
customer_reviews.author: mina

customer_reviews.title: Light and cozy tent ⛺
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tent for one person and have a little room left, or even better for a couple to make it nice and toasty inside, won't have much extra room though. This tent I really love because it's easy to put up and it's nice and cozy, you can sit cross legged with room above your head but no standing. Like I said if you like it cozy this is the tent for you. Got a little cold at night especially by the sides plus I had an inadequate sleeping bag ($25 one). But all in all very light and nice. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Angel arroyo

customer_reviews.title: One of the best tents at this price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very beautiful tent that is able to resist strong winds and rain, when I used it i felt like I was in a small room at home than in a tent with the new type foot ball field poles. What I did not like was the tent length and as with some reviews the top pole cross bar that can perhaps puncture the rain fly but I was able to solve this by putting rubber tips at the end of the pole where it comes in contact with the center of the rainy however, I recommend this tent you will not be disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Turnquest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tent and Helpful Staff
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this tent is perfect depending of course on your venture. My thru hike to my backyard was Treacherous but it was nice to find that set-up was struggle free and everything assembled nicely. In my sleep I decided to fight the tent and broke a couple of plastic clips but not because of durability just my carelessness. Reaching out to Featherstone was easy and they helped me get more than enough plastic hooks in case my carelessness resurfaced later. Very helpful staff and very nice tent. Quarantine has been pleasant with this tent, stay safe. #covid19
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for car camping.  Maybe to heavy for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Tent came with everything for set up - guy lines, stakes, footprint, rainfly. Easy for one person to assemble and disassemble. Can be used without the tent. Dislikes are tent attachments to the tent poles are plastic and could break easily. Tent pole crossbar for the entry doors need additional padding to prevent them from puncturing the tent OR tent needs a padded pocket for the ends of the crossbar. Personal preference would be to have a padded pocket on the tent. This would prevent ware/tear on the tent and assistance in the tent set up.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey P

customer_reviews.title: Badass tent.  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed. Pulled it out of the package and set it up by myself in less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this tent about five times now kayak camping in the Everglades. Went through a few pretty good storms not a drop of rain inside, withstood the winds, and even more important kept out the no see ums. I don’t have anything to compare to as this is my first tent purchase, But I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: veganrunnerSUP

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Most Part
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I LOVE IT. Easy to setup, good amount of space for just me and my stuff. Stayed perfectly dry in the rain, and comfortable. The only issue was the stakes. The heads broke off two of them when I was putting them in the ground, making them useless. Great otherwise though. Just have to get some stakes to replace them all.
customer_reviews.author: katie bochat

customer_reviews.title: Great starter backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent was quick and easy to set up. Kept me warm and well protected during a winter backpacking trip. Wind only no snow. Fit in my 45 L bag with plenty of room for the rest of my gear. The pole system is soooo easy to set up. Just took this tent on a 7 day thru hike. It held up so well and was easy to set up every evening. Loved that you can set it up without the stakes as on night we had to set up on a rocky area. This tent is an awesome bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Tent is super easy to assemble and backpack with. As of this review I've used the tent on two separate trips, both very windy trips. The tent held up perfectly on the first trip, gusts up to 35 mph. Unfortunately, on the second trip, gusts up to 50 mph bent some of the poles and the tent fell down. I contacted customer service and they were more than willing to send me replacement poles. 5 stars because the tent performed phenomenally given the two circumstances it has had to deal with so far and the customer service was great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Erhart

customer_reviews.title: Good product and value
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the tent yet but have set it up inside. Was easy to set up even without the stakes put in, good construction, seemed heavy for back packing but for my intended use it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent, Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this tent. No problems with it at all. Very easy to set up. Spent three nights in it on a recent trip and it worked great. Perfect size for one person and a lot of gear.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! I’m 6’2” and had plenty of head space. Very easy and quick one person set up. First time out of the bag used camping and had a torrential storm. 100% dry. When breaking camp in morning, realized water was pulled on tarp but nothing got into tent. Will wait to rate longevity, but awesome first use.
customer_reviews.author: William Kaup

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Quality parts. Plenty of room for two , but awesome for one. The rain cover allows for addition space for gear out side without getting rained on.
customer_reviews.author: William Furnas

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my Boy Scout / Scout BSA
customer_reviews.text: It was used once on a single over night campout. Two scouts used it and it seemed to work well. He really liked that it had a ground tarp. It also has reflective patches that I liked. He had it set up a few times prior to that over night campout. Their are many more campouts to use this on.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L. Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money, not ultralight
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice full featured tent for the money. It was easy to set up, roomy and seems well made. However, it's not light. 6 pounds with all components considered.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wade

customer_reviews.title: High end quality, nice price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used the tent yet, but after being at an outdoor store looking at tents that are $300 and appear have come from the same factory, I'm already impressed. My first test will be in the sierras next week!
customer_reviews.author: SteveC

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke after using 5 times.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper broke after the 5th time using the tent. It just won’t zip together. It was a decent, lightweight tent but has no longevity. It was well taken care of but now it’s virtually useless.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix, AZ

customer_reviews.title: No waterproof
customer_reviews.text: If your not using it in the rain it's great I didn't and it and it ruined my weekend have to come home early disappointed because it's really nice and light and I wanted to like it
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent so far
customer_reviews.text: At upwards of 5 lbs this isn't a solo backpacking tent. That said, I lugged it along on a flatlander backpacking adventure on Cumberland Island. I found it very easy to assemble and palatial for one person. It would be cozy for two. It only sprinkled a tiny bit one of the nights so I can't vouch for it's waterproof-ness. For the money, it is a great little tent, so far.
customer_reviews.author: mv

customer_reviews.title: Stated weights incorrect. Tent body/rainfly/poles/stuffsack = 78.7oz(4.9lbs) footprint adds 11.5oz.
customer_reviews.text: While i havent used the product yet to comment on quality, it looks to be decent.. especially for the price.. i was a little surprised to find that the weight that is advertised, along with other reviewers were different from each other, and from my findings.. btw my scale was checked and calibrated.. wish i would have had a review like this before i purchased...
customer_reviews.author: Shaun H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: Super simple setup High quality material Convenient tarp setup Packed size is relatively minimal Only nit-pick is the tent floor could be a little thicker, but there is a ground tarp.
customer_reviews.author: rdesignco

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one person camping if you like extra room!
customer_reviews.text: I like this tent a lot. My only concern is that I am worried In the hot weather if the rubbery feel to the rain fly outer shell would turn sticky and degrade over time.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! Two of the clear plastic clips that attach the tent to the frame broke after my first use. Featherstone customer service was incredibly helpful and advised they had modified this. They are sending me a new tent with better attachments at no extra charge. I used the one I had a second time and it not only held up extremely well in a severe rainstorm but kept me perfectly dry. The tent is light and portable; also set up, breakdown and packing up are a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelly J.

customer_reviews.title: Higher quality than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use yet, but the quality of the material is much higher than expected. The tent is large and easy to set-up and seems very comfortable. Only small con so far: in past customer feedback photos, the carry bag was a waterproof bag and the one I received was a drawstring bag. I emailed the company and after a lot of back & forth, they sent me a sample of a sleeping mat air pump, which is almost the same thing ;) I appreciate the effort!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Perfect for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is well worth the money. It’s long enough to keep some gear by your head or feet when you sleep and super easy to put up and take down. Pack size is excellent. I’m so glad I didn’t buy a more expensive tent. I might get some different stakes though as they are pretty wide and didn’t go into the ground very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Leah

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast setup! Great tent!!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to "Dislike" about this tent that I could find. Easy and fast setup; packs away in the stuff bag with no problems. Featherstone folks did their "Homework"!! Great job guys!
customer_reviews.author: Steve K. Matsumura

customer_reviews.title: Don’t think about it just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking for a few days in the Eastern Sierras. Performed perfectly. Easy setup/take down. I had no problems getting it back into its sack. We were met with thunder showers each day in the afternoon with significant wind and everything stayed completely dry inside. Amazing customer support. Upon arrival there was a small hole in sack. I emailed Featherstone and in a couple days they sent a replacement, no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: aw

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it for one backpacking trip thus far, but I am happy with its size and ease of setup. Would actually fit two people. I look forward to using it more.
customer_reviews.author: A. Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try for one of my boys scout camping. This is my 5th tent and i intend to use it for hike camping. It was very well made, my 11 year olds were able to set it up with no direction from me. All in all really like it. Impressed for the price, very impressed. I tend to buy 2 person tents for one person, i like plenty of room for packs. It is perfect for that. Good buy highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Bailey

product_meta.title: Featherstone 2 Person Backpacking Tent Lightweight for 3-Season Outdoor Camping, Hiking, and Biking - Includes Footprint, Waterproof, Packs Light and Compact
feature_bullets: DURABLE, LIGHTWEIGHT, & BREATHABLE: Rugged, Lightweight Tear-Resistant fabrics are Waterproof, keeping you dry inside. Micro-mesh fabric enhances breathability and comfort, reducing condensation.

2-PERSON: This backpacking tent is spacious enough to accommodate up to two people, perfect for couples. Conveniently built with two doors and two vestibules that provide great amount of storage space for your camping gear.
WEATHER PROTECTED: Seam Taped Construction makes an impenetrable barrier against Rain and prevents leakage. Bathtub Floor Design elevates the bottom of the tent to protect you from wet grounds.

EASY TO SET UP & FREESTANDING: Single Aluminum pole structure makes the tent easy to set up and pack into one’s backpack. Freestanding allows the tent to be moved and relocated without having to disassemble.
3 SEASON: This tent is suitable for 3 Seasons and preferred use for Hiking, Expeditions, Fishing, Kayaking, Car Camping, Backpacking, or Bikepacking.

WARRANTY & ACCESSORIES: Backed with a limited lifetime manufacturing warranty and from a U.S. company that cares. The tent also includes Aluminum Stakes, Reflective Guy Line Rope, and a Waterproof Footprint for added protection or ultralight set up.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
